required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Profile of Ophthalmological Care in the Public Service in Brazil
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiological Profile of Ophthalmological Care in the Public Service in Brazil

brief_summary.textblock: Epidemiological study about eye discomfort complaints, comorbidities and diagnosis at a Brazil`s ophthalmological public care service

detailed_description.textblock:
1. 1670 individuals underwent an ophthalmologic evaluation
2. The data were obtained through the analysis of the medical records with the ICD-10 registration
3. The studied variables were age and sex of patient, origin, eye discomfort complaints, comorbidities and diagnosis (ICD-10).
4. The purpose was to evaluate epidemiological aspects of eye diseases in a public service

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Retrospective

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and prevalence of visual conditions in the Public Service in Brazil
primary_outcome.description: The ages ranged from 0 to 99 years The mean age was 56.9 years There was a predominance of females (58.1%) The main reason for the consultation was low visual acuity (70%), followed by burning (26%) and itchiness (24.4%) Among the abnormal tests there was a high prevalence of refractive errors (73.4%) and presbyopia (59.6%) The cause of refractive errors was astigmatism (70.5%), hypertrophy (58.6%) and myopia (15.1%)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients assisted in public service
Exclusion Criteria:
